snippet: In 2006, Mitt Romney spent 212 days traveling outside Massachusetts, according to news reports, in what was widely regarded as the opening stage of his first campaign for president
abstract: In 2006, Mitt Romney spent 212 days traveling outside Massachusetts, according to news reports, in what was widely regarded as the opening stage of his first campaign for president
lead_paragraph: Newt Gingrich assailed Mitt Romney as a career politician who never stopped running for office -- not even when he was governor of Massachusetts.

headline.main: Debate Fact Check: Romney Running for President While Governor
